summary: All prior issues were fixed or are now consistent with the clarified spec, with no new blocking problems introduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: reserve() rounded/allowed NaN for estimated cost, risking under-reserve or NaN to Lua
Fail-closed reserve() returned INVALID_INPUT instead of explicit deny
previous_issues_status.notes: reserve() now returns BUDGET_EXCEEDED on Redis error.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Fail-open finalize() returned possibly NaN/negative cost
Audit log costCents could be NaN/negative
estimateCost() multiplied by 100 and allowed negative tokens
previous_issues_status.notes: Removed *100 and clamped token counts to non-negative.
Spec now clarifies raw[0] is status and raw[1]/raw[2] are count/total, so current parsing is correct.
